member.name: T:Palladio.Attributes.IIAttributeCollection
member.summary: Defines size, enumerators, and synchronization methods for strongly typed collections of elements.
member.remarks:
IIAttributeCollection provides an that is strongly typed for elements.
Version history:
$Log$ Revision 1.1.2.2 2004/12/02 23:37:39 uffi major changes in Palladio.Attributes, IAttribute added for implementations of attribute values, AttributeHash is now a typed Hashtable, IAttributeHash and Factories are currently obsolete, still in repository though.
Revision 1.2 2004/05/18 13:19:58 sliver Added Clone method for AttributeHash
Revision 1.1 2004/05/13 15:17:31 sbecker Initial import

member.summary: Copies the entire to a one-dimensional of elements, starting at the specified index of the target array.
member.param: The one-dimensional that is the destination of the elements copied from the . The Array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in at which copying begins.

exception.para: is equal to or greater than the length of .
The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from to the end of the destination .

member.name: T:Palladio.Attributes.IIAttributeEnumerator
member.summary: Supports type-safe iteration over a collection that contains elements.
member.remarks: IIAttributeEnumerator provides an that is strongly typed for elements.

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.IIAttributeEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: true if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.
member.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.IIAttributeEnumerator.Reset
member.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the collection.
member.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

member.name: P:Palladio.Attributes.IIAttributeEnumerator.Current
member.summary: Gets the current element in the collection.
member.value: The current element in the collection.

exception.para: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.
The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

member.remarks: Please refer to for details, but note that Current fails if the collection was modified since the last successful call to or .

member.name: T:Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry
member.summary: Implements a strongly typed pair of one key and one value.
member.remarks: IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry provides a that is strongly typed for keys and values.

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry.#ctor(Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeType,Palladio.Attributes.IAttribute)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key and value.
member.param: The key in the key-and-value pair.
The value in the key-and-value pair. This argument can be a null reference.

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry.op_Implicit(System.Collections.DictionaryEntry)~Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry
member.summary: Converts a to a .
member.param: A object to convert.
member.returns: A object that represents the converted .

exception.para: contains a key that is not compatible with .
contains a value that is not compatible with .

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry.op_Implicit(Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry)~System.Collections.DictionaryEntry
member.summary: Converts a to a .
member.param: A object to convert.
member.returns: A object that represents the converted .

member.name: P:Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry.Key
member.summary: Gets or sets the key in the key-and-value pair.
member.value: The key in the key-and-value pair. The default is a null reference.
member.exception: Key is set to a null reference.
member.remarks: is a value type and therefore has an implicit default constructor that zeroes all data members. This means that the Key property of a default-constructed IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry contains a null reference by default, even though it is not possible to explicitly set Key to a null reference.

member.name: P:Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeTypeIAttributeEntry.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value in the key-and-value pair.
member.value: The value in the key-and-value pair. This value can be a null reference, which is also the default.

member.name: T:Palladio.Attributes.AttributeHash
member.summary: Implements a strongly typed collection of key-and-value pairs that are organized based on the hash code of the key.
member.remarks: AttributeHash provides a that is strongly typed for keys and values.

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.AttributeHash.#ctor
member.overloads: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty and has the default initial capacity, the default load factor, the default hash code provider and the default comparer.

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.AttributeHash.#ctor(System.Collections.IHashCodeProvider,System.Collections.IComparer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty and has the default initial capacity, the default load factor, the specified hash code provider and the specified comparer.

param.name: provider
param.para: The that supplies the hash codes for all keys in the .
-or-
A null reference to use the default hash code provider, which is each key's implementation of .

param.name: comparer
param.para: The to use to determine whether two keys are equal.
-or-
A null reference to use the default comparer, which is each key's implementation of .

member.param: The approximate number of elements that the new is initially capable of storing.

-or-

param.name: comparer

-or-

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.AttributeHash.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty and has the specified initial capacity, the specified load factor, the default hash code provider and the default comparer.
member.param: The approximate number of elements that the new is initially capable of storing.
A number in the range from 0.1 through 1.0 indicating the maximum ratio of elements to buckets.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty and has the specified initial capacity, the specified load factor, the specified hash code provider and the specified comparer.

-or-
A null reference to use the default hash code provider, which is each key's implementation of .

-or-
A null reference to use the default comparer, which is each key's implementation of .

member.name: M:Palladio.Attributes.AttributeHash.#ctor(Palladio.Attributes.AttributeHash)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that contains elements copied from the specified dictionary and that has the same initial capacity as the number of elements copied, the default load factor, the default hash code provider and the default comparer.

member.name: T:Palladio.Attributes.DefaultAttributeType
member.summary: Stores information on the type of an attribute. The attribute type inherits IVisitable in order to e.g. allow specialised rendering of GUI elements to edit the value of the attribute.

remarks.pre:
Version history:
$Log$ Revision 1.1.2.2 2004/12/02 23:37:39 uffi major changes in Palladio.Attributes, IAttribute added for implementations of attribute values, AttributeHash is now a typed Hashtable, IAttributeHash and Factories are currently obsolete, still in repository though.
Revision 1.2 2004/05/17 14:07:33 sliver added interface for attributable classes
Revision 1.1 2004/05/13 15:17:31 sbecker Initial import

member.name: T:Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeType
member.summary: Stores information on the type of an attribute. The attribute type inherits IVisitable in order to e.g. allow specialised rendering of GUI elements to edit the value of the attribute.

member.name: T:Palladio.Attributes.IAttributeHash
member.summary: A hashtable containing attributes which are associated to certain objects in other data structures. Those attributes need to have a type.

$Log$ Revision 1.1.2.2 2004/12/02 23:37:39 uffi major changes in Palladio.Attributes, IAttribute added for implementations of attribute values, AttributeHash is now a typed Hashtable, IAttributeHash and Factories are currently obsolete, still in repository though.
